(Well, I had to do something. I think I'm gonna regret it in about ten 
seconds though>.< This is my first time posting ship wide damage, so bear 
with me. If something's amiss I'd appreciate it if you would let me know so 
I can correct it in my next post^_^ Be warned, I'm half awake and in need of 
much sleep:P)

Hysteria:

Hysteria remained crouched in the vent, doining her best to try and stop the 
invading 'bots. The ship itself was a mess compared to its original state. 
If only she could get the main weapon online! The CF's computer echoed 
against the walls of the small vent:

"Weapon's fire detected. Ten seconds until impact... 9... 8..."

Hysteria's fingers flew across the keyboard as she desperately tried to find 
something to power the shields. Perhaps she could reroute some power from 
the main engine room, the back up propulsion system... anything! There was 
something... the EMP cannon had a reserve power source. If certain 
connections weren'y severed then perhaps it would work:

"Computer, give me the technical diagram of the EMP cannon's connection to 
the CF."

According to the diagram one line was still intact, and the reserve power 
was just enough... not for the cannon, but perhaps it could power something 
else. She quickly tried to reroute the remaining power to the shields, and 
hit enter. Outside the CF the shields flickered to life. They were weak, and 
barely at 50%, but they were holding. The weapons fire hit the shield, one 
after the other sent ripples through it. The already weakened shields 
wouldn't last much longer against this type of assualt.

Hysteria turned to face the vent opening, and went sailing back as 
Vehement's missile struck her upper torso. Her laptop was destroyed in the 
blast, but the interface cord was still intact. Hysteria lay there, her 
armor was charred and sparking. She wasn't in stasis yet, but she wasn't 
getting up just yet.
